byline.contributor: Jeffrey Gettleman reported from Nairobi, and Laurie Goodstein from New York.
byline.original: By JEFFREY GETTLEMAN and LAURIE GOODSTEIN

abstract: Pope Francis begins first trip to Africa, starting with visit to Kenya; faces powerful and assertive local Roman Catholic Church that holds conservative and opposing views on social issues; will also visit Uganda and Central African Republic.
lead_paragraph: As Francis begins his first-ever trip to Africa, he will face a powerful and assertive Roman Catholic Church that is wary of his message of tolerance.

headline.main: A More Conservative Catholic Church Awaits Pope Francis in Africa
headline.print_headline: A More Conservative Church Awaits the Pope in Africa

snippet: As Francis begins his first-ever trip to Africa, he will face a powerful and assertive Roman Catholic Church that is wary of his message of tolerance.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
